name: Evan Shelhamer
content: Imaginary Number - Evan Shelhamer Imaginary Number is Evan Shelhamer: professor at UBC, vision and learning researcher, and open-sourceror. I earned my PhD in Computer Science at UC Berkeley in 2019 advised by Trevor Darrell as a member of Berkeley AI Research. Earlier on, I earned dual degrees in computer science (artificial intelligence concentration) and psychology at UMass Amherst advised by Erik Learned-Miller. I like to solve problems in artificial intelligence and scientific prototyping: research for computer vision and machine learning, and hacking, adapting, and deploying open-source research code. I have over ten yearsâ€™ experience in research and development for computer vision and machine learning and served as the lead developer of the Caffe deep learning framework from version 0.1 to 1.0. Feel free to write or check out my research site! Contact me: Evan Shelhamer shelhamer@imaginarynumber.net 413-728-5396 Elsewhere: Research Site Google Scholar scientific papers GitHub open-source coding Teaching Site
